title: Calling variants in non-diploid systems
questions: How does frequency of mitochondrial polymorphisms change from mother to child?
objectives: Using Galaxy's main site we will see how to call variants in bacteria, viruses, and organelles.
key_points: Variation in human mitochondria is a proxy for other haploid systems.
Nucleotide variants in haploid systems may have any frequency between 0 and 1.

Distinguishing true variants from noise is not easy and requires accounting
for strand bias and read placement bias.
FreeBayes can be effectively used to call variants in haploid systems.
